channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024020390
item.description:
Report X-2024020390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came from another station and was loaded upside down (opposite of indication arrows). Package was then found to have a loose cap on one of the bottles that was contained in the shipment. DescribePack: Loose cap on one of the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was turned right side up, and then put into a tote to help make sure nothing else leaked from it

item.title: Report X-2024020656
item.description:
Report X-2024020656

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: sometime yesterday afternoon the damaged package fell onto its side and leaked. someone placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked from the cap, staining the label of the other bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2024020439
item.description:
Report X-2024020439

  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on the rollers. It was then taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: One bottle in the package leaked out from the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Taken off of the rollers and into a drum, then brought to the hazmat cage

  • City: SAINT PAUL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET LEAKING ON MOST OF THE BOTTOM HALF OF THE BOX. DescribePack: CAP ON GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE BROKEN AND SEAL ALSO BROKEN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKED ALMOST ALL THE LIQUID OUT OF BOTTLE.

item.title: Report X-2024020493
item.description:
Report X-2024020493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: SHAKOPEE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found at the end of trailer immediately upon opening the door. There were two packages one was severely damaged from internal leaking which weakened the box and ripped. The other package FedEx tracking #639075741894 had a small puncture hole which was retaped and sent out for delivery. DescribePack: Two of the bottles had loose caps. The loose caps caused the package to be wet and weakened the box so much that 1/4 of the top was torn off. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat admin put the box in a hazmat bag and brought it to the hazmat cage for an assessment. The two soiled bottles and box were put in a hazmat bag. The other two bottles appeared to be unaffected and dry so were put into a separate bag while waiting further instructions.
